intro: Beureria praecox, commonly known as the early beureria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in woodland areas. Its flowering period occurs early in the growing season, hence its common name. Beureria praecox is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
